Mountain_View.NASA Sustainability Base: NASA Sustainability Base is a building at the Ames Research Center in Mountain View, California that was designed to exhibit and test the latest energy-saving technologies as part of the federal government's drive to eliminate fossil-fuel consumption in all new government buildings by 2030. The building was not initially conceived as a "sustainability base," but associate director Steven Zornestzer worked with architect William McDonough to create an energy-efficient building for the 21st century.  Energy-saving features include water recycling, fuel cell electricity generation, natural lighting, solar panels, and a geothermal well system.
